intro: Nitrosalsola libica, commonly known as the Canary Islands saltbush, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and coastal environments, thriving in saline soils. It has a compact growth habit with a branching stem that often grows close to the ground. Nitrosalsola libica is often found in rocky areas and is a common component of coastal vegetation in its native range.
